author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 27-year-old man, who scaled the compound wall and jumped into the house of the woman he was pursuing, was killed when she and her mother allegedly pushed him down, in Tiruvallur on Monday night.

According to the police, the deceased, Imam Hussain (27), a resident of Tondiarpet, was working as daily-wage labourer in Tiruvallur. A year ago, he was arrested for making advances to Imrana Tabasum (23), a resident of Nandiambakkam in Tiruvallur.

“Recently, he started troubling Tabasum again, expressing his desire to marry her. She kept avoiding him,” a police officer said.

On Monday night, Imam decided to pay her a visit.

“He jumped over the wall and entered the house. When he saw Tabasum, he allegedly pulled her hands. She and her mother threw some bleaching powder on his face and pushed him down,” added the officer. According to the police, the fall proved fatal for Imam.

“It is alleged that he died on the way to the hospital. The Minjur police have registered a case under section 174, CrPC,” the officer said.

Further investigation is on.

27-year-old tries to pull woman’s hand and bleaching powder was thrown on him
title: Man forcibly enters home, pushed to death
